|

Inherits properties from its parent, {{DOMxRef("HTMLElement")}}.

|
> |
{{DOMxRef("HTMLMarqueeElement.behavior")}} {{Deprecated_Inline}}
^ |
|

Sets how the text is scrolled within the marquee. Possible values are scroll, slide and alternate. If no value is specified, the default value is scroll.

|

Sets the amount of scrolling at each interval in pixels. The default value is 6.

| > |
{{DOMxRef("HTMLMarqueeElement.scrollDelay")}} {{Deprecated_Inline}}
^ |
|

Sets the interval between each scroll movement in milliseconds. The default value is 85. Note that any value smaller than 60 is ignored and the value 60 is used instead, unless trueSpeed is true.

macros.sourceContext:
|

Sets the interval between each scroll movement in milliseconds. The default value is 85. Note that any value smaller than 60 is ignored and the value 60 is used instead, unless trueSpeed is true.

| > |
{{DOMxRef("HTMLMarqueeElement.trueSpeed")}} {{Deprecated_Inline}}
^ |
|

By default, scrollDelay values lower than 60 are ignored. If trueSpeed is true, then those values are not ignored.

|

Event handlers

|
> |
{{DOMxRef("HTMLMarqueeElement.onbounce")}} {{Deprecated_Inline}}
^ |
|

Fires when the marquee has reached the end of its scroll position. It can only fire when the behavior attribute is set to alternate.

macros.sourceContext:
|

Fires when the marquee has reached the end of its scroll position. It can only fire when the behavior attribute is set to alternate.

| > |
{{DOMxRef("HTMLMarqueeElement.onfinish")}} {{Deprecated_Inline}}
^ |
|

Fires when the marquee has finished the amount of scrolling that is set by the loop attribute. It can only fire when the loop attribute is set to some number that is greater than 0.

    79. Plugin
    80. PluginArray
    81. PromiseRejectionEvent
    82. RadioNodeList
    83. UserActivation
    84. ValidityState
    85. Window
    86. WorkletGlobalScope

value.content:
Deprecated: This feature is no longer recommended. Though some browsers might still support it, it may have already been removed from the relevant web standards, may be in the process of being dropped, or may only be kept for compatibility purposes. Avoid using it, and update existing code if possible; see the compatibility table at the bottom of this page to guide your decision. Be aware that this feature may cease to work at any time.

The HTMLMarqueeElement interface provides methods to manipulate <marquee> elements.

It inherits properties and methods from the HTMLElement interface.

value.title: Instance properties
value.content:
Inherits properties from its parent, HTMLElement.

HTMLMarqueeElement.behavior Deprecated

Sets how the text is scrolled within the marquee. Possible values are scroll, slide and alternate. If no value is specified, the default value is scroll.

HTMLMarqueeElement.bgColor Deprecated

Sets the background color through color name or hexadecimal value.

HTMLMarqueeElement.direction Deprecated

Sets the direction of the scrolling within the marquee. Possible values are left, right, up and down. If no value is specified, the default value is left.

HTMLMarqueeElement.height Deprecated

Sets the height in pixels or percentage value.

HTMLMarqueeElement.hspace Deprecated

Sets the horizontal margin.

HTMLMarqueeElement.loop Deprecated

Sets the number of times the marquee will scroll. If no value is specified, the default value is âˆ’1, which means the marquee will scroll continuously.

HTMLMarqueeElement.scrollAmount Deprecated

Sets the amount of scrolling at each interval in pixels. The default value is 6.

HTMLMarqueeElement.scrollDelay Deprecated

Sets the interval between each scroll movement in milliseconds. The default value is 85. Note that any value smaller than 60 is ignored and the value 60 is used instead, unless trueSpeed is true.

HTMLMarqueeElement.trueSpeed Deprecated

By default, scrollDelay values lower than 60 are ignored. If trueSpeed is true, then those values are not ignored.

HTMLMarqueeElement.vspace Deprecated

Sets the vertical margin.

HTMLMarqueeElement.width Deprecated

Sets the width in pixels or percentage value.

value.title: Event handlers
value.content:
HTMLMarqueeElement.onbounce Deprecated

Fires when the marquee has reached the end of its scroll position. It can only fire when the behavior attribute is set to alternate.

HTMLMarqueeElement.onfinish Deprecated

Fires when the marquee has finished the amount of scrolling that is set by the loop attribute. It can only fire when the loop attribute is set to some number that is greater than 0.

HTMLMarqueeElement.onstart Deprecated

Fires when the marquee starts scrolling.

value.title: Instance methods
value.content:
Inherits methods from its parent, HTMLElement.

HTMLMarqueeElement.start() Deprecated

Starts scrolling of the marquee.

HTMLMarqueeElement.stop() Deprecated

Stops scrolling of the marquee.

value.title: Examples
value.content:
html

<marquee>This text will scroll from right to left</marquee>

<marquee direction="up">This text will scroll from bottom to top</marquee>

<marquee
  direction="down"
  width="250"
  height="200"
  behavior="alternate"
  style="border:solid">
  <marquee behavior="alternate">This text will bounce</marquee>
</marquee>

doc.summary: The HTMLMarqueeElement interface provides methods to manipulate <marquee> elements.
